panels.content:
# About This Dashboard

This dashboard is the basedashboard for vSphere which covers performance for below objects:

- vSphere ESXi
- vSphere VM
- vSphere Datastore

Users should **pick panels based on their own requirements**.

# Prometheus Exporter

Metrics are colleced by leveraging [telegraf](https://www.influxdata.com/time-series-platform/telegraf/) from Influxdata. A skeleton configuration file can be generated as below:

```bash
 telegraf --section-filter agent:inputs:outputs --input-filter vsphere --output-filter prometheus_client config > telegraf.conf
```

# Reference

- [Telegraf vSphere Input Plugin](https://github.com/influxdata/telegraf/tree/master/plugins/inputs/vsphere)
- [vSphere Performance Counter Reference](https://www.vmware.com/support/developer/converter-sdk/conv60_apireference/vim.PerformanceManager.html)
- [How to convert vSphere summation counters](https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/2002181)
- [Sample configurations](https://github.com/kckecheng/prometheus/tree/master/config/telegraf_vsphere)
panels.title: About

panels.description: Percent of time the virtual machine is unable to run because it is contending for access to the physical CPU(s)
panels.title: CPU Latency

panels.description: Percentage of time that the virtual machine was ready, but could not get scheduled to run on the physical CPU.
panels.title: CPU Readiness

panels.description: Total CPU time spent in wait state.The wait total includes time spent the CPU Idle, CPU Swap Wait, and CPU I/O Wait states.
